rComments: BEST prof ever!! Prof Gerlai is super wise & has a lot of experience in the field, brings real life examples into his lectures. The lectures are heavy but easy to follow. His style of teaching really makes you want to listen. Not hard to do good if you stay on top of your work. Ask questions, he's super approachable & caring & knows how to teach!!

Engages class with critical-thinking questions and anecdotes which makes the content memorable; test/exam Qs will focus on these so take note! Molecular bio/genetic background advised (UTM BIO206/207). Hardly accessible beyond class, but always open to questions within class and office hours. Overall, insightful and knowledgeable!
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: The course topic was ok but his teaching style could be better - does not cater to all types of learners (e.g. more examples, and rushed through explaining a concept).

One of the best profs at UTM, he is really caring towards students and enjoys talking about his research. The lectures are really interesting, the book is not required to get a good grade in the course but def helps. Tends to reuse tests, but that changes from year to year.

One of the fewest profs I genuinely like. Attending his classes was never boring and lass participation was fun too :) HE cares a lot for his students + research. However the content of the course itself was hard and ta marking was hard too. but its doable . I did both psy355 and psy397 and theres a lot of overlap btw them
He's pretty monotone, but if you really listen you will really like it and the way he explains. His questions are very thought provoking. Best of all, free marks for participation!

I can't say enough great things about Dr. Gerlai. Besides the man being a genius he cares about his students. He takes his time explaining concepts that most find difficult to understand and will not move on until everyone is clear on it. Material is very interesting and he tests fair.

Love this prof!  He's brilliant, makes complicated stuff easy to understand.  Gives lots of everyday life examples to help us with scientific concepts.  He is also funny and engaging in class.  You can tell he loves his research and teaching.  He is also approachable and cares about his students.
Hard material, but Dr Gerlai made it clear and interesting. Very helpful and friendly.  You have to go to class to follow.

Prof. Gerlai was really great, he made my day. He was witty and funny and we talked of chimps and bunnies. I thought it was the best with mediocre tests. I wish the best to all, I really had a ball, and I took it in the fall. Apart from the rhyming he was a really good instructor with the fluency of a conductor.
The course itself was meh, but the prof was okay.
brilliant and enthusiastic prof.  hard stuff but he made it easy to understand.

Coming from a Psych Specialist w/ a 3.8 GPA: don't take PSY397 with him! I liked PSY252, but he is totally disorganized in his 397 lectures, which makes it IMPOSSIBLE to study for the tests. He always has past tests available, and he sticks to them, but studying for this course is a still huge pain b/c his slides are totally useless. Don't do it!
LOVE HIM!! everyone who says he's boring is on crack. he is the best prof i've ever had! nice, caring, interesting, and makes me actually want to attend class! such a nice guy
The best professor I ever had!

If you don't have a biology background, then stay away! Course is super easy otherwise, but it was sad to see non-bio majors struggle in the course :(. Tests and exams have changed so you can't depend on it anymore. You really need to attend the lectures if you don't have a bio background. ALSO, he'll test you on the Darwin movie, so pay attention!
Stopped using past tests, and tests class on many things that were not covered or that he didn't focus on. His notes and lectures are very clear, but his tests and exams can be quite difficult.

Don't bother studying from past tests, as he no longer repeats questions. Taking 252 after finished my BIO major probably gave me an edge because I find the material extremely simple; but, people in class have openly expressed how they're struggling. Just write down everything he says, and try to wrap your head around the "big picture" concepts.
GREAT!!!!!!!!!!! He is a great prof!
pretty clear, a bit dull sometimes, but very interesting lectures - go to class and you'll get an A tests are almost identical ! - writing this during his class

Great Prof! He is sooo nice, defiantly knows his stuff. Test and exams are almost exactly the same as past years, but BEWARE of the TA's they are hard probably because they know people use the past test. If your TA doesn't give you a fair mark go see Gerlai, bumped my test up from a 65 to an 80! TA'S ARE HARD

He's such a sweet guy honestly! Textbook had a lot of useless information. Just honestly go to lectures and pay attention. Very fair tests. You don't need past tests to do well. Very straightforward lectures. Can get kind of boring at time! But overall a good prof!
the best prof ever :) he's soooooo nice i love him!!!! i would hug him if i could!

he does reuse same tests/exams. if you do take his courses, it IS worth getting a copy of his past tests. truthfully, he seems lazy and interested in his laboratory work than teaching. grading is subjective--depending on which TA you have marking. not worth taking if you want to gain knowledge. worth taking for an easy grade.

Yes he may use the exact same questions on his tests but beware of the TAs. Absolutely horrible! They once took 3 weeks to mark a test, finished 2 days before the final and refused to remark it. I mean who's going to commute all the way to UTM just to pick up a test? That's 3 hours of wasted time in my case. I hated them.

make sure to get the pasts tests - i was blown away that my exam was WORD FOR WORD the same as past exams.. just goes to prove how lazy he is. his lecture slides in 2011 had "2008" written on them, and he often came late and very unorganized. i was very enthusiastic about taking the course, but his laziness crushed it. a bird course though

Seriously adorable prof - he's soo cute...in a grown-up way, lol. To be honest, I didn't really pay much attention in class, but I felt bad if I didn't go. He usually lets you out early though! And he's super-nice and helpful if you ever need to go speak to him, and he seems like a really nice person, overall. I'd recommend this course. :)

Interesting course and a great professor! He's very knowledgeable and helpful. He repeats a lot of questions but make sure you know the exact answer or else TA's will mark hard!! If you have any questions about the course or remarking he's very approachable and lenient. Only 1 lecture a week and he let's you out early.Overall very enjoyable course
dont take anything with this guy if you want an A. if you do old tests and go to lecture, you can get a B. however, ive taken all three courses with him and A's are hard to come by. best to avoid him
very good proof, uses old test but TA`s mark very hard. Easy if you memorize old tests. Old exams all the same.

One of my favourite courses and professors. Some lectures he's a bit dry but the content is very interesting. It's easier if you've taken biology courses especially for the first test. MC questions are a bit weird because you can choose multiple options. You need a biology background especially for the textbook.
An awesome prof!!
Hard course, studied everything including past tests ... questions were vague and not repeated, maybe he did so a couple of years ago ... but not this year.
Yikes definitely not a bird course!
Oh wow, very interesting prof. He repeats past tests, but then the essay questions aren't repeated...worth hell of a lot of marks, and TAs marked hard :(
Yeah he does repeat questions. But the "creatives" are not repeated, and that is what screws your mark over completely. Expect to get zeros on creative question.
"Creatives" were marked so damn harshly! WTH?!

OMG! HE DID NOT REPEAT THE QUESTIONS FOR 2010 :( :( I don't what happened, he repeated the 2006 test in 2007 and the 2007 test in 2008. I think the office of the registrar caught up with him. HE DIDNT REPEAT FOR US! what a disappointment! In fact his courses are 10x harder because of the "creative" questions...ugh!

I took this course from hearing the rumors that he repeated past tests. It turned out as a disaster. He doesn't repeat the "creative" questions, which are a major part of the test and are impossible to score well in. Im an "A" student, and I always do well, however some of the questions are so ridiculous that you can't even study for. AVOID!

As everyone already mentioned, he definitely is a highly intelligent individual and explains complex biological concepts quite clearly. Although he recycles past tests, making it appear to be easy (apart from the 'creative questions'), the TA is brutal and so inconsistent with his marking! Therefore, it's a bit difficult to earn a decent mark.

avoid this course at all costs! Yes, it's true that Gerlai is a nice and brilliant man, but he gets an F for organization! If you want behavioural genetics take bio407 w/sokolowski. Yes it is true that ~70% of the test is reused, but the TA (Noam) is a very stingy marker - you will get 0 on the 'creative ?'s' FOR SURE, everyone else did!

The first test he reused about 50% of the questions from previous test, the second test he reused like 75% and the exam he reused like 90% of the questions. To do well: study his past tests! (but of course study the lecs too). He is not boring but not that exciting either sometimes he cracks jokes. TAKE THE COURSE (easier than psy290 or 295).
Amazing prof. Extremely Brilliant I must say. He will take the time to answer your question. Done a lot of researches in the field of Animal psychology and biology
One of my favourite profs.  Absolutely brilliant and enthusiastic.  Explains complicated science REALLY clearly!  I learned a lot in his classes.
Smart, enthusiastic, very knowledgeable, attends to questions from class and explains them very well.

Dr. Gerlai is brilliant. My advice is to take his upper level courses (355 & 397). You will gain an appreciation for neuroscience. He expands a lot on his own research as well, which is extremely impressive. His tests are beyond fair and very easy, and class discussions are excellent. Not only will you get a good mark, but you will have fun too.
Easy prof if you have old tests.

It's an easy course as he recycles tests & exams (the exam was a replica of the prior year's).  As for his teaching quality: he's disorganized, bored and thus boring, provides no help, doesn't maintain the website well, and his TA's are stickler's for regrades.
No Comments
Interesting class, but the 55% final is a little much.
No Comments
